sentences.sContent: I offered to pay the cost of the taxi.
Insurance to cover the cost of a funeral is possible.
sentences.sCn: 可以用保险支付葬礼费用。

sentences.sContent: This doesn’t include the cost of repairing the damage.
sentences.sCn: 这不包括修理破损的费用。

sentences.sContent: The new building’s going up at a cost of $82 million.
sentences.sCn: 新大楼正以8,200万美元的造价拔地而起。

sentences.sContent: A cassette/radio is included at no extra cost .
The funds will just cover the museum’s running costs .
sentences.sCn: 这些资金只够支付博物馆的运转费用。

sentences.sContent: ...Because of the high cost of disposing of these things in landfills...
...Printing with moveable type on paper dramatically reduced the cost of producing a book compared with the old-fashioned ones handwritten on vellum...
...The high cost of steam and the lesser need for speed kept the majority of the world's ocean freight moving by sail until the early years of the 20th century...
...a Bible cost more than a middle-class house...
...it was reported that the cost of enrolling an infant or small kid at a childcare center rose 3% in 2012...
...faster than the overall cost of living...
...which cost more but sounded less fun...
...for other students who don’t have such a luxury it’s an added layer of cost — and an expensive one at that...
...Over the years the cost of a college education has increased almost by 100%...

synos.tran: 花费；使付出；使花许多钱
费用，[贸易]代价，[会计]成本；损失

phrases.pCn: 工程项目成本；施工费用
营业成本；业务费用；经营费用
无论如何；不惜任何代价（等于at all costs）
使用费；使用费用；生产费用；营业费；运转成本
有成本效益的；划算的；成本效率

words.tran: 不花钱的；无须付出代价的

trans.tranOther: the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy, do, or produce something
